name: European Consortium of Innovative Universities
goal:
ECIU is an acronym for European Consortium of Innovative Universities.

The partnership was established in 1997 and registered as a Foundation under Dutch law with 11 European members and 1 associate partner in Mexico.




The ECIU’s vision is:

ECIU challenging conventional thinking

ECIU is the leading international consortium of research intensive universities, with collective emphasis on innovation, creativity and societal impact, driving the development of a knowledge-based economy.

The three focus areas of activities for the next years are:
Innovation in Teaching and Learning
Entrepreneurship and Societal Impact of Research
EU Policy
interests: Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
H2020 / FP9
Erasmus+ / successor E+
Smart Specialisation
University Business Collaboration
Modernisation of Higher Education / European Education Area
Life Long Learning
European Innovation Council
Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions
